video.title: jQuery events - Beau teaches JavaScript
video.description:
In jQuery, most DOM events have an equivalent jQuery method.

Learn about jQuery events in this video.

💻 Code: https://codepen.io/beaucarnes/pen/gRZvpo?editors=1011

🐦 Beau Carnes on Twitter: https://twitter.com/carnesbeau

topLevelComment.author: Stevenson Nelson
topLevelComment.text: The hover syntax doesn't make sense to me. there is a extra " } " angel bracket . and no one writes it out live for me.

replies.author: Code Learner
replies.text:
there is two separate functions in there, so if you look to the right of both functions, you will see the opening brackets that hook up to the extra closing bracket that you are talking about.

3 years late, but oh well

topLevelComment.author: Binary Gear0101
topLevelComment.text: How can you do the following: attach two events of the same type to an element with each event having a different handler function, and each time the event is triggered, a different handler function is therefore used. for example: clicking a button and each time it's clicked a link's href is changed (fluctuating between two href's of course).

topLevelComment.author: onekool Guy
topLevelComment.text: I always fall back to Beau to clarify things. Great tutorials.
